PathOfBuilding.Notes:
*I||I* Note on Slavedriver's Hand *I||I*
Increase / reduce trap throwing speed according to how much cast speed you have -30%.
*I||I* About the damage *I||I*
While the average hit isn't super impressive, the actual damage output is. Lets do a worst case scenario where 3 of the explosions of each trap overlap. We throw 4 traps per cast. We throw 2.5 traps per second. We get unlucky and none of our traps trigger an additional time. Our target is locked down by bear trap. Our average damage is 100k for the sake of simplicity.
100k * 3 [ explosions ] * 4 [ traps ] * 2.5 [ casts per second ] * 1.15 [ bear trap } = 3.45m DPS
Lets do a better scenario, where 5 of the explosions of each trap overlap. We also get lucky and 3 of our traps trigger an additional time.
100k * 5 [ explosions ] * 4 [ traps ] * 2.5 [ casts per second ] + ( 100 * 5 * 3) [ Extra trigger] * 1.15 [ bear trap ] = 6.725m DPS
So at 100k average damage we are looking at a minimum of 3.45m DPS, and at least 6.7m as upper limit.
Getting additional trap throwing speed will greatly increase the damage per second, assuming you don't hit the maximum trap limit.
*I||I* What about Defence, mana and where is my Tinkerskin?! *I||I*
So 3.3 removes the cooldown and charge limit from traps, allowing us to spam them as much as we want until we either run out of mana or hit the maximum trap limit. 3.3 Also bring us the unique Slavedriver's Hand, which got the mode "skills which throw traps have blood magic". Saboteurs "Pyromaniac" node gives us 1% life regen per trap triggered recently up to 20%.
With cluster trap and a trap cast speed of 0.4 we throw 4 * 2.5 = 10 traps per second, which means that within 2 seconds we have reached 20% of life regenerated per second. Assuming a mana cost of 100 per cast, we spend 250 mana per second. With 4.8k hp and a level 20 stone golem we regenerate 1k life per second, giving us a net regen of 750.
This all means that there is no point in getting any mana whatsoever. The massive regen also means that the life / es recovered from Tinkerskin is negliable, especially since traps need to be triggered by an enemy and will not provide any bonuses if they trigger through Chain Reaction.
So to summarize our defences
> 5k+ Life and 1.4k+ ES for a eHP of 6.4k+ > 850 - 1 100+ life regenerated per second > Nearby Enemies are Blinded > 10% Reduced damage taken from blinded enemies > Stone Golem which Taunts > Taunted enemies deal 10% less damage to tagets that aren't the source of taunt > Playstyle of a trapper is defensive by default.
*I||I* Other Notes *I||I*
